>arch-mages could just summon as many elementals as they wanted, and 
basically use them as a cheap insta-death spell.

Cheap?  As a summoned fire elemental loses health, it drains health 
from the archmage who summoned it.

Things could be set up so that when a summoned fire elemental uses 
suicide attack, it takes 25%-50% (depending on available health of the 
archmage: if the archmage has more health less percent is used, but if 
the archmage is at 50% health or lower, at least 40% of the archmage's 
health is taken for each suicide attack) of the archmage's health 
along with it.

That way, by the time the 2nd fire elemental is "sacrificed", your 
archmage is in deep trouble if it gets hit.  If the archmage isn't in 
trouble at that point, then why are you "sacrificing" summoned fire 
elementals?
